Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2012 08:19PM simplya wrote: CaringBridge is the biggest scam out there...The concept is wonderful a place to communicate with friends and family while a loved one is going though often life threatening illness, you can post pictures updates and friends can comment it is perfect until you look at it from the point of view of the visitor.  For example: Oh, here is a picture of little Jeremy his hair is gone and his eyes are lifeless...and the posts left from his mom are so sad...you think to yourself...I just have to do something and you look to the right of the page and it says make a donation in tribute to Jeremy.  Oh you think this is the right thing to do you know the family has more Dr bills than they can comfortably deal with...here is where you can help.  Your emotions have in their grasp because you have just read about the terrible things happening to Jeremy and you have a visual of the little boy in your head from the pictures posted so you're not really thinking...clearly and you make a donation...thinking this will help.  And that is where you were just scammed.  Jeremy and his family will not see a dime of the money you donated it will go to the website "caringbridge" and because they receive far more donations then they need it will sit in a bank or moneymarket account not helping 1 person.  The financial statements on their site are vague the numbers do not jive. If you want to use a service to communicate with friends and family use something like facebook it is free and they make their money in an obvious way through adds not trickery.   And if you want to donate $ to a person write them a check or ask them to open a paypal acct it is at least honest. Shame on you caringbridge for not stating very clearly that donations do not go to any of the people on the sites!
